titleInfo.title: Letter No. 43: William Hornby, John Carnac, Daniel Draper, Nathaniel Stackhouse, William Ashburner, Andrew Ramsay and Thomas Day, Council at Bombay, to [John Beaumont, Resident at Bushire]

mods.abstract: This letter, received on 16 November 1780, via the MercuryPacket, has no stated recipient, but it can be assumed to be addressed to the Resident at Bushire, John Beaumont. The letter begins by discussing the woollen trade. The authors then state that, further to Beaumont's request to be relieved of the Residency, he is asked to hand over the Factory to the new appointee, Edward Galley, who arrived on the Mercury(with salary to 31 March, diet money and passage allowances). Beaumont is requested to return to India on the Mercury.
